definition: to win power/to get authority/to become dominant
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals

sentences.english: They, too, are a good barometer of who is up and who is down.
sentences.chinese: 这同样也是体现谁家得势谁家失意很好的晴雨表。

sentences.english: There is no imminent threat of the government being overthrown, but the Taliban has gained momentum.
sentences.chinese: 近期不存在阿政府被颠覆的危险，但塔利班开始得势。

sentences.english: Leafs will be astrut in breeze but chill when gale makes them falling down.
sentences.chinese: 树叶得势时趾高气扬，失意时威风扫地。

sentences.english: Those members of Crown Prince Party have risen to fame on the coat-tails of their fathers.
sentences.chinese: 太子党成员之所以得势不过是靠父亲而已。

definition: to hold power
to wield (political etc) power/be in power
to be in a position of power
to overthrow/downfall/to fall from power/to go bankrupt
one-party (state)
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
to be a favorite/favor
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to accomplish one's ambition/a dream come true/to enjoy success
to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
When the tree topples the monkeys scatter. (idiom); fig. an opportunist abandons an unfavorable cause/Rats leave a sinking ship.
domineering/bossy
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
political enemy/opponent
(of status or wealth) to decline/(of buildings etc) to become dilapidated/run-down/(of plants) to wilt
